reviewText: this is a great dvd set from dimmu borgir. it is loaded with live footage, behind the scenes stuff and videos. the only problem i have is that on disc 2 the live wacken show has no sound. i'll be taking my copy back to get it replaced. i hope that this doesn't happen on all copies because the wacken footage LOOKS great. if the sound was there, this dvd would get 5 stars easilyUPDATE : NUCLEAR BLAST IS RECALLING ALL OF THE DVDS. THEY TOLD ME TO SEND IT BACK TO WHERE I BOUGHT IT TO GET A REFUND. THEY ARE PLANNING ON RERELEASING IT LATER WITH COPIES THAT WORK.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The first disc is a concert disc featuring a concert from Oslo on tour in 2007. Good sound, good gig, good camera work. Lots of extras, though the behind the scenes stuff is just really drunk people filming other drunk people doing not so interesting drunk things. The second disc apparently does not play the audio for most folk on their stand alone DVD players. Playing it on the iMac worked flawlessly as it does on a PC using the media player. Hopefully they fix this in future editions. The Wacken show here though is incredible as well. The third disc is a CD of live session for apparently a TV show of some kind... also amazing. There are all their videos and a few photos and things thrown in as well. So it's two huge thumbs up, with the warning that the second disc probably will have no sound on a regular DVD player.
summary: A great set with a flaw.
Title: N/A

reviewText: First, let me say I was hesitant to get this when i heard people were saying Wacken has no sound.Then i thought well at least it's worth it for the videos and the other live stuff, so i went ahead and ordered it(It only took 3 days to receive it!)Well I am so glad that i did. I was reading what people were saying about how good the Wacken footage looked and let me tell you not only is it stunning visualy, but the concert is freaken killer! They put on one heck of a show. How I got it to work: when the menu pops up for wacken(the red line underneath it) I push title (track search) on my remote and the number 1 and then play.THAT'S IT. It worked for me. The videos were great also, anyone else noticed that on the two new ones, 'The Sacrilegious Scorn' and 'The Chosen Legacy' how much louder they are? I am very impressed with this whole package. This is definetly a must have.  The Wacken concert is sick!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm a punk rocker who took a weird Oedipal journey into the bowels of death metal looking for something that would resonate with my visions of the Next Rock Revolution. Of course, when you delve into the bowels of anything, more likely than not you wind up with $*** in your hands, but in this case, I discovered the highly entertaining and melodic style of Dimmu Borgir, Kings of the Cookie Monsters!Not to insult the prodigious Norwegian death metal monsters, but their over-the-top Satanism, strongly contradicted by the crowds of teenyboppers hopping and bopping on their live DVD's, make you realize that they're about as Antichrist as KISS, who were self-admittedly all about making money. This doesn't question the Borgirs' authenticity, it's just being skeptical of their abject devil worship (as in opening lines like "Satan! My Master!"). Yeah, right.These kids definitely have something going that may one day take them the way of Chemical Romance. They lean heavily on prerecorded orchestral music that gives their repertoire a powerful symphonic presence, and their cookie monster style provides them with a unique gimmick that we haven't seen in the death metal genre. They've got a powerhouse rhythm section that drives the band from start to finish, and a credible lead vox/guitar duo makes us think that Norway definitely has a contender for the heavy metal crown in time to come.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Incredible double dvd from the masters of norwegian symphonic black metal. Featuring 2 complete concerts and a bucketload of extras.I used to be into brutal black metal only and someone gave me this to open my mind and boy they did it !! Main feature on disc 1 is 17 tracks culled from a set in Oslo and songs from gigs in Germany and the UK totalling some 80' of live music.The performance is intense, the stage is dimly lit for effect and the bass player puts out a hell of a show; pity his impressive 5-string Warlock can barely be heard, if at all. He also adds some clean vocals here and there but the lip-sync is dubious, as if they came from a DAT tape or had been heavily pro-tool post-produced . Never mind, since the end result, if a little light in the bottom-end department, is very good. The  band has stunning stage presence.There is a backstage feature (drunken antics) embedded but you have to hit enter whenever a red symbol appears on the low right corner of the screen, which totally detracts from the flow of the live gig and I did try to access this feature separately at the end but didn't succeed.Pic is excellent for standard def (1.85:1) but the sound is uneven. I could have used heavier bottom end on the main feature and lighter on the extras (Berlin-London, which have little audible guitar and OTT vocals and are there to extend the meagre 40' the Oslo show runs for. The Oslo gig begins with almost no audible guitars, goes on with super-loud guitars with homicidally trebley tone to them and as the show progresses the guitar recorded on the right channel fades till it disappear completely toward the 3-4 final songs. The2.0 sound is useless because it sounds WAY louder on the right channel so I had to resort to 5.1 which is not my cuppa for live gigs but evened the soundscape. Volume is incredibly loud, making it difficult to adjust.Disc 2 starts out with a complete set at Wacken Open Air Fest, at night with the exact same lighting. Most of the songs are the same but the mix is now more keyboard-heavy. The cymbals, unlike on the fist disc, are now loud and clear. Bottom end is a LOT weaker; Had to crank my 12, 250 watts JBL sub a lot. On some songs the kickdrum sound is well-mixed, but on others it's like an earthquake, as if Laureano actuated his pedal a lot harder. Galder's axe is now more audible on the right channel but has a weird tone. The set goes on for some 75' and can be watched back-to-back with that on disc one without risking repetitiveness due to the aforementioned differences. Start out with OTT vocals though but they're corrected as the show progresses.Extras are 3 songs from P3 sessions(taped at a huge auditorium-shaped radio studio in Norway designed for broadcasting of live bands). The sound is rawer but both guitars are gorgeously audible and vox has a perfect level.Then 6 awesome videoclips ensue and to my surprise the studio sound of the songs is VERY different from the live versions. This is almost too much bang for the buck and has made me a fan of the band.The menus are very elaborated with lots of animations but it's slow and a pain to navigate.The two dual DVD 9 set comes in a transparent case with a glossy booklet so thick it makes it feel like a brick in your hand. However, other than the lyrics to some songs, illustrations and artsy pics of member of the band, it is uninformative to the point of not even featuring a tracklist. Highly recommendable in spite of the flaws,esp. of you are a fan of the band. In spite of being a clear case of quantity over quality, this is a good release no fan can do without.
Title: N/A
